reason.tex: \text{Just so you know, we tried many approaches} \\ \text{before finding the one given below - integration}\\ \text{by parts, factorizing }x^2+3x-18\text{ etc.} \\ \text{None of them resulted in an expression that was}\\ \text{easy to integrate.}\\ \textbf{Sometimes, you just have to try 2 wrong}\\ \textbf{approaches before finding the one right one.} \\ \begin{align} x^2+3x-18 &= \underbrace{x^2 + 2\dfrac{3}{2}x + \dfrac{9}{4}}_{(x+a)^2=x^2+2ax+a^2} - 18-\dfrac{9}{4} \\ &= \left(x+\dfrac{3}{2}\right)^2 - \dfrac{81}{4} \\ &= \left(x+\dfrac{3}{2}\right)^2 - \left(\dfrac{9}{2}\right)^2 \\ \text{Also }x+3 &= \left(x+\dfrac{3}{2}\right)-\dfrac{9}{2} \\ \therefore x' &= \left(x+\dfrac{3}{2}\right)\text{ and } A = \dfrac{9}{2} \end{align}

\begin{align} I_1 &= \int x'\cdot\sqrt{x'^2- A^2}\cdot dx \\ \text{Let }x'^2-A^2 &= z^2 \implies x'\cdot dx' = z\cdot dz \\ \therefore I_1 &= \int \sqrt{z^2} \cdot (z\cdot dz) = \int z^2\cdot dz \\ &= \dfrac{z^3}{3} + C_1 = \dfrac{(x'^2-A^2)^\frac{3}{2}}{3} + C_1 \\ &= \dfrac{(x^2+3x-18)^\frac{3}{2}}{3} + C_1 \end{align}

\text{We found }I_1\text{ in Step 2. So, we only}\\ \text{need to find }I_2. \\ \begin{align} &I_2 = A\int\sqrt{x'^2-A^2}\cdot dx \\ &= \underbrace{ \dfrac{A}{2}\cdot\left[x'\sqrt{x'^2-A^2}-A^2\log\vert x' + \sqrt{x'^2-A^2}\vert\right]} _{\int\sqrt{x^2-a^2}dx=\frac{1}{2}\cdot \left[x\sqrt{x^2-a^2} - a^2\log\vert x + \sqrt{x^2-a^2}\vert\right]} + C_2 \\ &\text{But } x' = \left(x + \frac{3}{2}\right), A = \frac{9}{2} \\ &\therefore I_2 = \frac{9}{4}\left[ \left(x+\frac{3}{2}\right)\sqrt{x^2+3x-18} \\ &- \frac{81}{4}\log\left\vert \left(x+\frac{3}{2}\right) + \sqrt{x^2+3x-18}\right\vert \right] \\ &\text{and }I = \dfrac{(x^2+3x-18)^\frac{3}{2}}{3} - \\ &\frac{9}{4}\left[ \left(x+\frac{3}{2}\right)\sqrt{x^2+3x-18} \\ &-\frac{81}{4}\log\left\vert \left(x+\frac{3}{2}\right) + \sqrt{x^2+3x-18}\right\vert \right] + C \end{align}
